poem:
"Parable of Power in the Dawn's Veil"

In the labyrinth of power, Sunak roams,
Veiled in statistics, truths become a chatter. 
A dancing silhouette of government loans, 
and Rwanda's future hangs from a dagger. 

Goldsmith 'fore the committee poses queries,
Within half an hour, secrets set to unveil. 
Oh, how politics in the language of fairies,
Is both a firmament and a frangible grail.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
